sourceRowPitch + srcOffset;<!----></span><br>        uint8_t *destRow         = destData + writeRow * destRowPitch + destOffset;<span class="line"><!---->        uint8_t *destRow         = destData + writeRow * destRowPitch + destOffset;<!----></span><br>        memcpy(destRow, sourceRow, copySize);                           <== oob write<span class="line"><!---->        memcpy(destRow, sourceRow, copySize);                           &lt;== oob write<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>The StretchedBlitNearest_RowByRow function calls memcpy with length = destArea.width * pixelSize.<span class="line"><!---->The StretchedBlitNearest_RowByRow function calls memcpy with length = destArea.width * pixelSize.<!----></span><br>So if destArea.width is negative, memcpy will write out of bounds.<span class="line"><!---->So if destArea.width is negative, memcpy will write out of bounds.<!----></span><br>In a 32bit process, the attached poc.html can set the memcpy length to         This bug requires manual review: DEPS changes referenced in bugdroid comments.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: DEPS changes referenced in bugdroid comments.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by ggabu...@gmail.com (Jun 11, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by ggabu...@gmail.com (Jun 11, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by ggabu...@gmail.com (Jun 11, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by ggabu...@gmail.com (Jun 11, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<span class="line"><!---->There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<!----></span><br><br>blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<span class="line"><!---->blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<!----></span><br><br>The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<span class="line"><!---->The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<!----></span><br><br>Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<span class="line"><!---->Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<!----></span><br>This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<span class="line"><!---->This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<!----></span><br>(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<span class="line"><!---->(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<!----></span><br>So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<span class="line"><!---->So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void Context::blitFramebuffer(GLint srcX0,<span class="line"><!---->void Context::blitFramebuffer(GLint srcX0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint srcY0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint srcY0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint srcX1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint srcX1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint srcY1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint srcY1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstX0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstX0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstY0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstY0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstX1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstX1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstY1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstY1,<!----></span><br>                              GLbitfield mask,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLbitfield mask,<!----></span><br>                              GLenum filter)<span class="line"><!---->                              GLenum filter)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    .....<span class="line"><!---->    .....<!----></span><br><br>    Rectangle srcArea(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1 - srcX0, srcY1 - srcY0);<span class="line"><!---->    Rectangle srcArea(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1 - srcX0, srcY1 - srcY0);<!----></span><br>    Rectangle dstArea(dstX0, dstY0, dstX1 - dstX0, dstY1 - dstY0);<span class="line"><!---->    Rectangle dstArea(dstX0, dstY0, dstX1 - dstX0, dstY1 - dstY0);<!----></span><br><br>    if (dstArea.width == 0 || dstArea.height == 0)<span class="line"><!---->    if (dstArea.width == 0 || dstArea.height == 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(syncStateForBlit());<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(syncStateForBlit());<!----></span><br><br>    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(drawFramebuffer->blit(this, srcArea, dstArea, mask, filter));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(drawFramebuffer-&gt;blit(this, srcArea, dstArea, mask, filter));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b         This bug requires manual review: DEPS changes referenced in bugdroid comments.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: DEPS changes referenced in bugdroid comments.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), benmason@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), benmason@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by ggabu...@gmail.com (Jun 11, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">

        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<span class="line"><!---->There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<!----></span><br><br>blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<span class="line"><!---->blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<!----></span><br><br>The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<span class="line"><!---->The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<!----></span><br><br>Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<span class="line"><!---->Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<!----></span><br>This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<span class="line"><!---->This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<!----></span><br>(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<span class="line"><!---->(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<!----></span><br>So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<span class="line"><!---->So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void Context::blitFramebuffer(GLint srcX0,<span class="line"><!---->void Context::blitFramebuffer(GLint srcX0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint srcY0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint srcY0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint srcX1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint srcX1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint srcY1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint srcY1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstX0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstX0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstY0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstY0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstX1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstX1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstY1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstY1,<!----></span><br>                              GLbitfield mask,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLbitfield mask,<!----></span><br>                              GLenum filter)<span class="line"><!---->                              GLenum filter)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    .....<span class="line"><!---->    .....<!----></span><br><br>    Rectangle srcArea(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1 - srcX0, srcY1 - srcY0);<span class="line"><!---->    Rectangle srcArea(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1 - srcX0, srcY1 - srcY0);<!----></span><br>    Rectangle dstArea(dstX0, dstY0, dstX1 - dstX0, dstY1 - dstY0);<span class="line"><!---->    Rectangle dstArea(dstX0, dstY0, dstX1 - dstX0, dstY1 - dstY0);<!----></span><br><br>    if (dstArea.width == 0 || dstArea.height == 0)<span class="line"><!---->    if (dstArea.width == 0 || dstArea.height == 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(syncStateForBlit());<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(syncStateForBlit());<!----></span><br><br>    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(drawFramebuffer->blit(this, srcArea, dstArea, mask, filter));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(drawFramebuffer-&gt;blit(this, srcArea, dstArea, mask, filter));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>In Context::blitFramebuffer, the width and height of areas are calculated as (X1 - X0) and (Y1 - Y0).<span class="line"><!---->In Context::blitFramebuffer, the width and height of areas are calculated as (X1 - X0) and (Y1 - Y0).<!----></span><br>If srcX0 is greater than srcX1, width will be negative.<span class="line"><!---->If srcX0 is greater than srcX1, width will be negative.<!----></span><br><br>Next, the blitRenderbufferRect function will be called.<span class="line"><!---->Next, the blitRenderbufferRect function will be called.<!----></span><br>(readRectIn is srcArea, and drawRectIn is dstArea)<span class="line"><!---->(readRectIn is srcArea, and drawRectIn is dstArea)<!----></span><br><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect(const gl::Context *context,<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect(const gl::Context *context,<!----></span><br>                                               const gl::Rectangle &readRectIn,<span class="line"><!---->                                               const gl::Rectangle &amp;readRectIn,<!----></span><br>                                               const gl::Rectangle &drawRectIn,<span class="line"><!---->                                               const gl::Rectangle &amp;drawRectIn,<!----></span><br>                                               RenderTargetD3D *readRenderTarget,<span class="line"><!---->                                               RenderTargetD3D *readRenderTarget,<!----></span><br>                                               RenderTargetD3D *drawRenderTarget,<span class="line"><!---->                                               RenderTargetD3D *drawRenderTarget,<!----></span><br>                                               GLenum filter,<span class="line"><!---->                                               GLenum filter,<!----></span><br>                                               const gl::Rectangle *scissor,<span class="line"><!---->                                               const gl::Rectangle *scissor,<!----></span><br>                                               bool colorBlit,<span class="line"><!---->                                               bool colorBlit,<!----></span><br>                                               bool depthBlit,<span class="line"><!---->                                               bool depthBlit,<!----></span><br>                                               bool stencilBlit)<span class="line"><!---->                                               bool stencilBlit)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    .....<span class="line"><!---->    .....<!----></span><br><br>    gl::Rectangle readRect = readRectIn;<span class="line"><!---->    gl::Rectangle readRect = readRectIn;<!----></span><br>    gl::Rectangle drawRect = drawRectIn;<span class="line"><!---->    gl::Rectangle drawRect = drawRectIn;<!----></span><br>    if (readRect.isReversedX())<span class="line"><!---->    if (readRect.isReversedX())<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        readRect.x     = readRect.x + readRect.width;<span class="line"><!---->        readRect.x     = readRect.x + readRect.width;<!----></span><br>        readRect.width = -readRect.width;<span class="line"><!---->        readRect.width = -readRect.width;<!----></span><br>        drawRect.x     = drawRect.x + drawRect.width;<span class="line"><!---->        drawRect.x     = drawRect.x + drawRect.width;<!----></span><br>        drawRect.width = -drawRect.width;<span class="line"><!---->        drawRect.width = -drawRect.width;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    if (readRect.isReversedY())<span class="line"><!---->    if (readRect.isReversedY())<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        readRect.y      = readRect.y + readRect.height;<span class="line"><!---->        readRect.y      = readRect.y + readRect.height;<!----></span><br>        readRect.height = -readRect.height;<span class="line"><!---->        readRect.height = -readRect.height;<!----></span><br>        drawRect.y      = drawRect.y + drawRect.height;<span class="line"><!---->        drawRect.y      = drawRect.y + drawRect.height;<!----></span><br>        drawRect.height = -drawRect.height;<span class="line"><!---->        drawRect.height = -drawRect.height;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    .....<span class="line"><!---->    .....<!----></span><br><br>    else<span class="line"><!---->    else<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!----> Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<span class="line"><!---->There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<!----></span><br><br>blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<span class="line"><!---->blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<!----></span><br><br>The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<span class="line"><!---->The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<!----></span><br><br>Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<span class="line"><!---->Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<!----></span><br>This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<span class="line"><!---->This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<!----></span><br>(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<span class="line"><!---->(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<!----></span><br>So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<span class="line"><!---->So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void Context::blitFramebuffer(GLint srcX0,<span class="line"><!---->void dstY0,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstY0,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstX1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstX1,<!----></span><br>                              GLint dstY1,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLint dstY1,<!----></span><br>                              GLbitfield mask,<span class="line"><!---->                              GLbitfield mask,<!----></span><br>                              GLenum filter)<span class="line"><!----> class="line"><!---->    Rectangle dstArea(dstX0, dstY0, dstX1 - dstX0, dstY1 - dstY0);<!----></span><br><br>    if (dstArea.width == 0 || dstArea.height == 0)<span class="line"><!---->    if (dstArea.width == 0 || dstArea.height == 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(syncStateForBlit());<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_CONTEXT_TRY(syncStateForBlit());<!----></span><br><br> filter));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>In Context::blitFramebuffer, the width and height of areas are calculated as (X1 - X0) and (Y1 - Y0).<span class="line"><!---->In Context::blitFramebuffer, the width and height of areas are calculated as (X1 - X0) and (Y1 - Y0).<!----></span><br>If srcX0 is greater than srcX1, width will be negative.<span class="line"><!---->If srcX0 is greater than srcX1, width will be negative.<!----></span><br><br>Next, the blitRenderbufferRect function will be called.<span class="line"><!---->Next, readRect.height, 1);<!----></span><br>        gl::Box drawArea(drawRect.x, drawRect.y, 0, drawRect.width, drawRect.height, 1);<span class="line"><!---->        gl::Box drawArea(drawRect.x, drawRect.y, flip operation will be executed.<!----></span><br>However, the flip operation will also be executed on drawRect where drawRect.width may be positive.<span class="line"><!---->However, the flip write out of bounds.<span class="line"><!---->So if destArea.width is negative, memcpy will write out of bounds.<!----></span><br>In a 32bit process, the attached poc.html can set the memcpy length to         This bug requires manual review: DEPS changes referenced in bugdroid comments.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: DEPS changes referenced in bugdroid comments.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <style>

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;

          display: none;

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<span class="line"><!---->There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<!----></span><br><br>blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<span class="line"><!---->blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<!----></span><br><br>The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<span class="line"><!---->The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<!----></span><br><br>Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<span class="line"><!---->Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<!----></span><br>This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<span class="line"><!---->This function should handle all cases, so the blitFramebuffer should normalize its arguments.<!----></span><br>(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<span class="line"><!---->(For example, "blitFramebuffer(0, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0, 10 10);" and "blitFramebuffer(10, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 10, 10);" have the same effect.<!----></span><br>So in this case, function needs to flip srcX0 and srcX1.)<span Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<span class="line"><!---->There is a out-of-bounds write bug that is caused by the Renderer11::blitRenderbufferRect function when blitFramebuffer function is called.<!----></span><br><br>blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<span class="line"><!---->blitFramebuffer(srcX0, srcY0, srcX1, srcY1, dstX0, dstY0, dstX1, dstY1, mask, filter);<!----></span><br><br>The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<span class="line"><!---->The blitFramebuffer function copies a specific area from READ_FRAMEBUFFER to DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER. This areas is a rectangle, so this function needs the coordinates of two points representing the rectangle.<!----></span><br><br>Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<span class="line"><!---->Possible cases are (x0,y0)-(x1,y1) or (x1,y1)-(x0,y0) or (x1,y0)-(x0,y1) or (x0,y1)-(x1,y0).<!----></span><br>This function should handle Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
